intro: Daucus elegans, commonly known as the slender carrot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, grooved stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic common to many members of its family. Daucus elegans is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
